channel.title: Amelia Wattenberger
channel.description: Thoughts on data visualization, d3.js, frontend development, and design.

item.title: Speeding up force simulations with spirals
item.dc:creator: Amelia Wattenberger
item.description: D3.js force simulations are great for implementing basic physical rules, but they can be expensive to run. Here's a trick I've used in the past to speed up those simulations.
item.content:encoded: D3.js force simulations are great for implementing basic physical rules, but they can be expensive to run. Here's a trick I've used in the past to speed up those simulations.

item.title: How to create a Gauge component in React.js
item.dc:creator: Amelia Wattenberger
item.description: Let's create a Gauge in React! Gauges are great at showing context around a single value. Is it high or low? Is it larger or smaller than this other value? But what we'll learn here isn't really about creating a gauge, it's about learning the concepts we could use to create one.
item.content:encoded: Let's create a Gauge in React! Gauges are great at showing context around a single value. Is it high or low? Is it larger or smaller than this other value? But what we'll learn here isn't really about creating a gauge, it's about learning the concepts we could use to create one.

item.title: The CSS Cascade
item.dc:creator: Amelia Wattenberger
item.description: We style our websites using CSS, which stands for Cascading Style Sheets, but what does Cascading really mean? To save ourselves from future angst, let's take a step back and learn this thing for real.
item.content:encoded: We style our websites using CSS, which stands for Cascading Style Sheets, but what does Cascading really mean? To save ourselves from future angst, let's take a step back and learn this thing for real.

item.title: Scaling SVG Elements
item.dc:creator: Amelia Wattenberger
item.description: Scaling svgs can be a daunting task, since they act very differently than normal images. Instead of thinking of svgs as images, let's get an understanding of viewBox and change our mindset.
item.content:encoded: Scaling svgs can be a daunting task, since they act very differently than normal images. Instead of thinking of svgs as images, let's get an understanding of viewBox and change our mindset.

item.title: Thinking in React Hooks
item.dc:creator: Amelia Wattenberger
item.description: React introduced hooks one year ago, and they've been a game-changer for a lot of developers. There are tons of how-to introduction resources out there, but I want to talk about the fundamental mindset change when switching from React class components to function components + hooks.
item.content:encoded: React introduced hooks one year ago, and they've been a game-changer for a lot of developers. There are tons of how-to introduction resources out there, but I want to talk about the fundamental mindset change when switching from React class components to function components + hooks.

item.title: How to learn D3.js
item.dc:creator: Amelia Wattenberger
item.description: So, you want to create amazing data visualizations on the web and you keep hearing about D3.js. But what is D3.js, and how can you learn it? Let’s start with the question: What is D3?
item.content:encoded:
So, you want to create amazing data visualizations on the web and you keep hearing about D3.js. But what is D3.js, and how can you learn it? Let’s start with the question: What is D3?

While it might seem like D3.js is an all-encompassing framework, it’s really just a collection of small modules. Here are all of the modules: each is visualized as a circle - larger circles are modules with larger file sizes.

item.title: Interactive Charts with D3.js
item.dc:creator: Amelia Wattenberger
item.description: This is 2019 and the web browser opens up a whole new realm of possibilities when visualizing data.
item.content:encoded:
You did it! You grabbed a data set and visualized it, right here in the browser. Congratulations, that is no easy feat!

This is 2019 and the web browser opens up a whole new realm of possibilities when visualizing data. Let’s take advantage of these new possibilities and talk about how to take your chart to the next level.
